definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: Langdon was grateful simply for the opportunity to meet him.
sentences.chinese: 蘭登因這次見面的機會簡直對他感激不盡。

sentences.english: You saved my life, I am forever in your debt.
sentences.chinese: 你救我了的命，我永運感激不盡。

sentences.english: I'd be grateful if you wll let me know soon.
sentences.chinese: 如果你肯早點告訴我，我會感激不盡。

sentences.english: The humble in sheep station worked all day, very grateful friend Tony.
sentences.chinese: 一介在牧羊場工作了一整天，好友湯尼感激不盡。

sentences.english: It is here where the services of an experienced undertaker are most appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 就是這時，大家纔會對經驗老道的仵工感激不盡。

sentences.english: I would appreciate it if you could comment. Thanks a million.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能不吝賜教，我會感激不盡的。

sentences.english: Hope to people can help, next is deeply grateful.
sentences.chinese: 望才之人能相助，在下感激不盡。
你的眼睛將對你感激不盡。

sentences.english: Emperor grateful, thank to face Poseidon.
sentences.chinese: 始皇感激不盡，要面謝海神。

sentences.english: Your support to a paperless environment would be appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 本會對閣下支持無紙化環境感激不盡。

sentences.english: I can't thank you enough for helping me with my English.
sentences.chinese: 你幫我學英語真讓我感激不盡。

sentences.english: A: Yes, I'd appreciate it if you could drive me downtown.
sentences.chinese: 要，如果你能開車送我進城，我會感激不盡。

sentences.english: We anticipate and would appreciate your full cooperation in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 希望在這件事情上您能夠全力配合，我們感激不盡。

sentences.english: And I am very grateful for this nice arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 對於這次美好的安排，我感激不盡。

sentences.english: I got off the streetcar in a downpour and thankfully opened the umbrella to protect myself.
sentences.chinese: 我在傾盆大雨中下了車，感激不盡地那把傘遮雨。

sentences.english: Fortunately, you were there to save him. For this we are most grateful.
sentences.chinese: 幸虧有你救了他，我們都很感激不盡。

definition: to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
